titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Dewit Napier, Hezakiah Harmon and Thomas Fitzpatrick, Indictment
CWG5340

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Adair Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against }
Dewit Napier, Hezakiah Harmon and Thomas Fitzpatrick

The Grand Jury of Adair County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Dewit Napier Hezakiah Harmon and Thomas Fitzpatrick & James Pendleton of the crime of Malicious and willful shooting with intent to kill Committed as follows towit the said Napier Harmon and Fitzpatrick and & James Pendleton on the 1st day of August 1864 in the county aforesaid did Feloniously willfully and wickedly shoot at one C. L. Rice with intent to kill him the said Rice which said shooting was then and there done with guns loaded with powder and leaden balls or other hard substance and without wounding the said C. L. Rice against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J. H C Sandidge
Atty for the Commonwealth
A Copy
Attest James T. Page C A C C
No 1
Comth of Ky
vs } Indictment
Dewit Napier &c
A Copy
20cts fee
